result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Lamar Howell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-Pay all of the following by Probation on Case 2016CF4186: all court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA); all applicable fees of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample.
-If REVOKED, collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Credit for 381 days.

Court advised defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Lamar Howell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case recalled. Appearance remain the same. Parties have reached an agreement. State request that Body Attachment be withdrawn for witness. Court withdraws Body Attachment for Nastaja H.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties are prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Tammi H. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections, credit for 381 days time served, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by probation on case 2016CF4186 failure to pay will result in civil judgment, if revoked collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.

Court advised defendant of appellant right.
Court advised defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Defense request that order be lifted for Telephone, Visitation, and US Mail Custody Privileges. Court grants defense request and orders defense to draft order.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody. Ian Vance-Cruzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties ready to proceed. Case passed until afternoon for court to address calendar.
Body attachment returned.  Defaulting witness in court (Nastaja Hannah).  Court releases witness as case has been resolved.  No further action taken.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address remaining calendar. Case recalled later in the morning. Appearances remain the same. State places additional offer to defendant. Defendant denies offer. State revokes offer. Court being reliably advised that witness Nastaja H. has been duly subpoenaed and served, court ordered a body attachment issued for default witness.  BODY ATTACHMENT ISSUED and given directly to the Sheriff's Deputies. Defense motion to dismiss. Arguments heard. Court denies defense request to dismiss at this time. Court adjourns in Branch 18.  Jury trial scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Witness failing to appear, Court ordered a Body Attachment to be issued for Nastaja H.
Order Granting Telephone, Visitation, and US Mail Custody Privileges signed and filed.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. State advised court that no additional charges have been issued for the motion hearing. Defense request modification to no contact order with mother. Arguments heard as to no contact order. Court order modification to allow contact with family members. Defense to draft order. Case remains calendar for jury trial 2-27-2017 9:00 am in Branch 18.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State provides additional information in support of motion for continuance.  Court grants state's motion.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 18.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  Statements by state that new charges may be issued.  State's motion for continuance argued.  Court orders case adjourned to 1:30 pm.
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Court orders defendant's mail, phone and visitor privileges rescinded, excluding attorney contact.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  First call:  Defendant's appearance waived.  Statements by state as to victim.  Court passes case.  

Back on the record.  Same appearances. 
Second call:  Defendant in court.  Parties are prepared to proceed.  In-chambers discussion placed on the record.  State's motion to adjourn argued.  Court denies state's moton to adjourn and orders case adjourned to Branch 18.  State places offer on the record.  Jury trial scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial with 16CF4186.  For reasons stated on the record, the state requests an adjourned trial date.  Defense objects.  Court grants request and orders case adjourned for jury trial to Branch 18.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
filed by the State:  Amended Witness List
Court grants state's motion to join 16CF4186, 15CM2097, 15CM2268, and 15CM4488 for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-07-2016 at 9:00 am in Branch 18.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Defense counsel requests more time for possible joinder of cases. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests more time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Dluzak informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 8/23/2016.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. Court preapproves transfer to branch 30 for global resolution if accepted.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
On motion of the defense Court set bail in the amount of $300.00 with TOT to Justice point if posted.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes,  all parties on in receipt  of the doctor's report. No corrections or additions. All parties stipulate to the findings in the report that the defendant is competent to proceed.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense counsel has not had an opportunity to review the doctor's report with the defendant.  Return on doctor's report adjourned in Branch 47.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Dr. Pankiewicz report dated 4/4/2016, received and filed
from Dr. John Pankiewicz dated 4/4/16, received and filed.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Joshua Lamar Howell not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informs the court that they believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.    Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 47. Same bail.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Hastaja H

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. COURT RECOMMENDS HIGH CASH BAIL UPON APPREHENSION.
State filed notice of motion and motion to increase bail.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justice point report received and filed. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice point report received and filed. lr

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr
Violation report received and filed. lr
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Nastaja H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Joshua Lamar Howell in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
